descripcion: Nathan gets buzz for a yogurt shop by creating a controversial flavor. He also devises a scheme for 8-minute pizza delivery.
Nathan discovers the professional Santa he's helping has a dark secret and his attempt to market a petting zoo has unexpected results. Also, a teen is caught doing graffiti.
Nathan encourages a clothing store to allow shoplifting and trains a new assistant. A restaurant owner is surprised when Nathan asks to be included in her will.
Nathan helps an independent gas station by devising the world's greatest rebate. He also attempts to make a fledgling caricature artist famous.
Nathan tries to help a struggling haunted house. He also attempts to overcome his fear of the opposite sex by dating ten women at once.
Nathan helps a struggling funeral home, a burger joint is forced to stand by its claim that it has the best burger in Los Angeles, and Nathan goes skydiving.
In this special episode, Nathan performs a daring escape in which he risks a fate that is truly worse than death, and failed business ideas from the season are showcased.

Nathan puts a private investigator to the test by allowing himself to be spied on for a day, a taxi company is brought a solution for shy customers, and Nathan is forced to include product placement in his show.
Nathan convinces a mechanic to verify his estimates with a polygraph test, and rebrands a realtor to sell only ghost-free homes.
Nathan's plan to help a Hollywood souvenir shop has surprising consequences.
A pet store is given a new way to advertise; Nathan challenges a maid service to clean a house in six minutes.
Nathan helps a liquor store sell to underage customers; an exterminator learns how to work discretely.
Nathan uses parody law to help a struggling coffee shop.
Nathan helps a dating website attract female users; a party planner is given a new way to send out invites; Nathan also shares his strategy for self-motivation.
Nathan tries to get press for a taxi company; a hot dog stand implements Nathan's new customer service initiative.
Nathan shows a toy company how to market to children; a movie theater instates a no-sharing policy at the concession stand; Nathan reconnects with an old friend.
Nathan faces off against a big corporation in an attempt to help a struggling electronics store.
Nathan helps overweight people to be able to take horse riding lessons and also helps a Boutique business to increment their number of customers.
Nathan tries to get laborers to work for free at a moving company.
Nathan attempts to secure an endorsement deal for a sporting-goods store, and an antique shop learns how to better utilize their "You break it, you buy it" policy.
Nathan helps a dive bar get around anti-smoking laws.
A hotel tries to appeal to sexually active parents, a travel agent finds out how profit from her elderly customers, and Nathan shares his solution for never being late.
Nathan helps a nail salon overcome racial stereotypes while providing a service. Meanwhile, Nathan proves to the world, once and for all, that he is fun to hang out with.
Nathan tries to prove that there's a hero inside every one of us.
In a special episode hosted by Anthony Napoli, Nathan checks in with former guests of the show, including Brian Wolfe and the Ghost Realtor.
Nathan helps a small-town diner with an act of extreme generosity.
Nathan helps a chili maker sell his chili at a closed event. Nathan promotes a massage parlor in an unusual way.
Nathan teams up with a struggling taxi driver to take down Uber.
Nathan hones his storytelling skills.
Nathan teaches an international exporter how to ship smoke alarms tax-free.
Nathan helps a computer repair shop earn the public's trust, and a psychic's marketing turns personal.
Nathan attempts to help a Bill Gates impersonator reunite with his long-lost love.
